intro: Spermacoce burchellii, commonly known as the African starling bean, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to purple flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in grasslands and woodland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. The leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture.
